page.title: 20Hugglescote
page.content: Documentary evidence appeared in 1220, when{Hugglescote}was linked with the churches of{Ibstock}and{Donington. Originally in the{fiefdom of Chester,} in 1512 it became the property of {Thomas Grey.}The first{Manor}was built in the 15th century. In 1564, 35 families lived in{Hugglescote}and {Donington. The{Leicester}to{Ashby}turnpike passed through. The final{Enclosure Act}1774 enclosed 130 acres. The earliest{Baptist Church}was erected in 1760, whilst in 1835 the first school was at{Glebe Farm,}with 12 boys and 11 girls paying 1d weekly. The population exploded with the development of the railways and coal industry.
